page.title: 07FISHING IN WATERGATE BAY 2
page.content: When caught the fishermen put the Mackerel in a bucket and wait for them to die. Then the heads and tails and guts are cut into slices to use as bait,their heads, tails and guts are thrown overboard for the blood to attract fish,although the seagulls get quite a lot The boats used sonar to find the fish and when we found a shoal we dropped anchor and baited our rods. The sonar told us the depth to find the fish and we dropped our lines and slowly wound them in. Everyone caught a fish the heaviest fish was a Ray of 13lb, Pollack was most frequently caught although we also caught Lemon Sole, Conger Eels, Cod, Munkfish and Angler fish. Steven Boxell caught a rubber dingy which had drifted out from the beach. A Conger Eel almost caught him when it pulled him off the boat trying to escape.
